text: The Geometry Spreadsheet pane displays more details about the geometry you select in the network editor. This pane details what the values are and lets you inspect data that doesn’t have visualization. Use this pane to view more information about the selected geometry’s points, vertices, primitives, and detail attributes. By default, the pane lists the groups and attributes of the geometry’s points.

Click a column header to sort the information by that column in ascending order. Click on the column header again to sort the information in descending order. Large entries (100 million for example) make sorting computationally expensive, though reverse sorting is fast. Sorting is not redone if the geometry changes, so if you move frame to frame you have to re-sort by clicking another column.
